intro: Eriospermum lanimarginatum, commonly known as the narrow-margin eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with a distinctive margin that is often hairy or frayed. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Eriospermum lanimarginatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
